questions.question_text: External audits have identified recurring exceptions in the user termination process, despite similar internal audits having reported no exceptions in the past. Which of the following is the IS auditor’s BEST course of action to improve the internal audit process in the future?

choices.D: Include the user termination process in all upcoming audits.
choices.B: Review the internal audit sampling methodology.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
External audits identifying recurring exceptions in the user termination process, despite clean internal audit reports, suggest a potential flaw in the internal audit methodology—particularly in sampling techniques or scope adequacy. The IS auditor’s best course of action is to review the internal audit sampling methodology (Option B).

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST metric to measure the quality of software developed in an organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The best metric for measuring software quality is C. Number of defects discovered in production. It provides a direct, outcome-based assessment of the software’s reliability and performance in a live environment, which are core aspects of quality. Unlike the other options, it focuses on the software itself rather than indirect factors or process inputs.

choices.C: Number of defects discovered in production
choices.B: Reduction in the help desk budget
choices.A: Amount of successfully migrated software changes

questions.question_text: An IS auditor is preparing for a review of controls associated with a manufacturing plant’s implementation of industrial internet of Things (IoT) infrastructure. Which of the following vulnerabilities would present the GREATEST security risk to the organization?

choices.A: Insufficient physical security around the IoT devices for theft prevention
choices.D: IoT devices that are not using wireless network connectivity
choices.B: Use of open-source software components within the IoT devices
choices.C: Constraints in IoT device firmware storage space for code upgrades

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Inability to update firmware due to storage constraints leaves hardware vulnerabilities and firmware flaws unpatched, which are frequently exploited in IIoT attacks. For example, vulnerabilities in Mitsubishi and OMRON controllers required firmware updates to mitigate risks like arbitrary code execution or denial of service.

questions.question_text: What is the BEST control to address SQL injection vulnerabilities?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
SQL injection is a technique used by attackers to inject malicious SQL code into database queries, resulting in unauthorized access to databases and information leakage. This vulnerability occurs when input data is not properly validated.

Selected Answer: D
A lower expected error rate reduces the required sample size because the auditor assumes fewer errors exist in the population. If the population is anticipated to be error-free (expected error rate ≈ 0%), statistical sampling principles permit a smaller sample to confirm this assumption. Also ISACA’s audit sampling guidelines 'G10 Audit Sampling' explicitly state: "Smaller sample sizes are justified when the population is expected to be error-free"

choices.B: The IS audit staff has a high level of experience
choices.C: The data can be directly changed by users.
choices.A: Proper separation of duties is in place.
choices.D: It is expected that the population is error-free.
